## BcryptHasher.compare() method

Verifies plain text against a bcrypt hash

**Signature:**

```typescript
compare(text: string, hash: string): Promise<boolean>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

text


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Plain text password to verify


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

hash


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Previously generated bcrypt hash


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;boolean&gt;

Promise resolving to true if text matches hash, false otherwise

## Exceptions

{<!-- -->Error<!-- -->} When bcrypt comparison fails (invalid hash format, system issues)

## Remarks

Securely compares the provided text with the stored hash by: 1. Extracting salt and cost factor from the stored hash 2. Hashing the input text with the same parameters 3. Comparing the resulting hashes in constant time

## Example


```typescript
const hasher = new BcryptHasher();
const isValid = await hasher.compare(
  'userInputPassword',
  '$2b$10$X12aC9b6B9Uf9Z8Z9Y8Z9O...'
);
if (isValid) {
  console.log('Password is correct');
}
```
